s.text: "Let's face it, the pathologies are severe in these areas," Jackson said.

The editors of the conservative journal Always Right wrote last week that Pepper's argument amounted to "a blame-the-victim-type approach that only serves to help those in the African-American community who want to avoid sharing responsibility for getting at the root causes of what is really a societywide problem."
And the intellectual elites who once defended standards have proved all too willing to go silent in the face of deviant behavior like Newt Gingrich's affair with a staffer.
"Let's face it, the pathologies are severe in these areas," Jackson said.
